about.name: Montreal
about.info_text: Montreal is a dynamic and culturally rich city located in the province of Quebec, Canada. Known for its bilingual heritage, the city combines French and English influences, creating a unique and vibrant atmosphere. Montreal is famous for its diverse neighborhoods, historic architecture, and a thriving arts and culinary scene. Visitors can explore the charming Old Montreal, enjoy world-class museums and galleries, and savor the city's delicious cuisine. Whether you're interested in history, art, or simply enjoying a lively urban experience, Montreal has something for everyone.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 1.8 million
Province: Quebec
Time Zone: Eastern Time Zone (UTC-05:00)
Languages: French, English
Currency: Canadian dollar (CAD)
about.climate_text: Montreal experiences four distinct seasons, with cold winters and warm summers. Average temperatures range from -12°C (10°F) in winter to 26°C (79°F) in summer, making it an ideal destination for winter sports and outdoor festivals.

attractions_card.title: Old Montreal (Vieux-Montréal)
attractions_card.description: Old Montreal is a historic district with cobblestone streets, stunning architecture, and a European charm. Visitors can explore landmarks like Notre-Dame Basilica and enjoy the vibrant street life.

attractions_card.title: Mont Royal Park (Parc du Mont-Royal)
attractions_card.description: Mont Royal Park offers a natural escape in the heart of the city, with hiking trails, scenic viewpoints, and the iconic Mount Royal Cross.

attractions_card.alt: Montreal Museum of Fine Arts (Musée des beaux-arts de Montréal)
attractions_card.title: Montreal Museum of Fine Arts (Musée des beaux-arts de Montréal)
attractions_card.description: The Montreal Museum of Fine Arts is one of Canada's most prominent art institutions, featuring an extensive collection of artworks from various periods and cultures.

attractions_card.title: Biodome de Montreal
attractions_card.description: The Biodome is a unique indoor nature exhibit housed in a former Olympic facility, allowing visitors to explore four distinct ecosystems and their wildlife.

attractions_card.title: Jean-Talon Market (Marché Jean-Talon)
attractions_card.description: Jean-Talon Market is a bustling farmers' market in the Little Italy neighborhood, offering fresh produce, local foods, and artisanal products.

attractions_card.title: Botanical Garden (Jardin botanique de Montréal)
attractions_card.description: Montreal's Botanical Garden is a haven of greenery and botanical wonders, featuring themed gardens and the beautiful Chinese Garden.

attractions_card.title: Notre-Dame Basilica
attractions_card.description: Notre-Dame Basilica is a stunning Gothic Revival church known for its intricate interior design and impressive stained glass windows.

attractions_card.alt: Museum of Contemporary Art (Musée d'art contemporain de Montréal)
attractions_card.title: Museum of Contemporary Art (Musée d'art contemporain de Montréal)
attractions_card.description: The Museum of Contemporary Art showcases contemporary and avant-garde art through a variety of exhibitions and installations.

food_card.title: Poutine
food_card.description: Poutine is a Canadian dish made of french fries topped with cheese curds and smothered in savory gravy. A must-try Quebecois specialty.

food_card.title: Bagels
food_card.description: Montreal is famous for its unique style of bagels, characterized by their smaller size, sweet flavor, and the traditional method of wood-fired baking.

food_card.title: Smoked Meat Sandwich
food_card.description: A Montreal smoked meat sandwich features deliciously spiced and smoked beef piled high on rye bread with mustard.

food_card.title: Tourtière
food_card.description: Tourtière is a traditional meat pie, often served during the holiday season, and comes in various regional styles.

food_card.title: Maple Syrup
food_card.description: Quebec is renowned for its high-quality maple syrup, which can be found in various products, from syrup to candies.

hotels_card.title: Fairmont The Queen Elizabeth
hotels_card.description: Fairmont The Queen Elizabeth is a historic and elegant hotel located in downtown Montreal, offering luxurious accommodations and dining.

hotels_card.title: Hotel William Gray
hotels_card.description: Hotel William Gray is a boutique hotel in Old Montreal with a contemporary design, a rooftop terrace, and scenic views.

hotels_card.title: Le Mount Stephen Hotel
hotels_card.description: Le Mount Stephen Hotel is a luxury boutique hotel in a historic mansion, known for its opulent décor and exceptional service.

hotels_card.title: Ritz-Carlton Montreal
hotels_card.description: The Ritz-Carlton Montreal is a landmark hotel offering timeless luxury, world-class dining, and a prestigious address.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Nelligan
hotels_card.description: Hotel Nelligan is a charming boutique hotel in Old Montreal, known for its comfortable rooms and a rooftop terrace with panoramic city views.

transport_card.title: STM Metro
transport_card.description: The Société de transport de Montréal (STM) operates the metro system, making it easy to navigate the city and reach various attractions.

transport_card.title: BIXI Bike Share
transport_card.description: BIXI is Montreal's popular bike-sharing system, providing a convenient way to explore the city on two wheels.

transport_card.title: Taxis
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available in Montreal and can be hailed on the street or requested through mobile apps.

transport_card.title: Pierre Elliott Trudeau International Airport
transport_card.description: Pierre Elliott Trudeau International Airport (YUL) is Montreal's major airport, serving both domestic and international flights.
